meanings.definition: A book containing a collection of detailed records of illustrative cases, especially in law or medicine.
meanings.sent1: In his casebook, the lawyer kept notes on all the interesting legal cases he had worked on.
meanings.sent2: The medical student referred to her casebook to study different patient scenarios.
meanings.sent3: The detective's casebook was so full of mysteries, it almost seemed magical.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a casebook, storing every detail of the cases she encountered.
meanings.sent5: The casebook was like a treasure trove of knowledge, waiting to be explored.

meanings.definition: A book containing a collection of cases for study or reference.
meanings.sent1: The professor assigned the casebook for the students to review before the exam.
meanings.sent2: She found the casebook to be a valuable resource for her research project.
meanings.sent3: Carrying the heavy casebook around campus felt like a workout.
meanings.sent4: The casebook was a roadmap to understanding complex legal cases.
meanings.sent5: The worn-out casebook showed signs of being well-loved and frequently used.
